hanzi-su-wiki:
竜

Значения

Дракон

Мнемоника

Дракон с большим брюхом с хвостом (нижняя часть). Пожирает молодых людей 立.

Варианты

龍, 龙
purpleculture_pinyin:
lóng
Japanese variant of 龙
Японский вариант дракона
rtega_mnemonic:
龍龍RS
龙龙		㡣龍竜dragon, symbolic of emperor
  • RS. a snake with a king 𦚏 on it's head: → → 龍 → 竜
  • ⓢ 龍 → → 龙
  • Did you ever see a Chinese dragon? If he stands 立 up you will see his body looks like the butt of turtle 亀
heisig_constituent: dragon, vase, stand up, eel, sun, day
heisig_story: Vase . . . eel. In order not to confuse this kanji with the zodiacal sign of the dragon, which we will meet later (Frame 2164) and use as a primitive, you might think here of a paper parade dragon.
koohiiStory1: Have you ever seen an asian DRAGON? it looks like an eel, but can stand up because it has legs.
koohiiStory2: If the poor villagers don´t provide him with a vase full of eels each day, the dragon will lay waste to the village.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The dragon radical is the same as this kanji, which is dragon.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Not to dragon with it, but make sure you know your radicals so you know your kanji!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Imagine a dragon. You are talking to it, which is already pretty strange, but as you're talking, he turns into the Street Fighter character Ryuu (りゅう).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Then imagine after his transformation he attacks you using his Street Fighter moves. "Hadouken!"
Ru_Notes: Реже: 龍 (たつ、リュウ дракон) — классическая версия. См. также: 辰 (たつ、シン、ジン знак дракона, 5-й знак китайского зодиака).

竜字的基本解释

竜
lóng
古同“龙”。

竜字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lóng］
同“龍1”。
[②]［néng］
同“能1”。

竜字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【立字部】　竜； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页870第38
【集韻】龍古作竜。註見部首。　又【類篇】起也。　又地名。【字彙補】雲南有佴革竜地，有九山最險。

竜字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
竜字的起名意思

暂无。

[Afternoon Collection] [Li Zi Department] 　long; Kangxi strokes: 10; Page number: page 870-38
[Ji Yun] Long Gu made long. Note see radicals.　[Classes] again.　Also place name. 【Word Supplement】Yunnan has the leather and long land, but the Jiushan is the most dangerous.

lóng
яп. вм. 龙
Radicals: 竜  (dragon)
Meaning Mnemonic
The dragon radical is the same as this kanji, which is dragon.
Not to dragon with it, but make sure you know your radicals so you know your kanji!
Reading Mnemonic
Imagine a dragon. You are talking to it, which is already pretty strange, but as you're talking, he turns into the Street Fighter character Ryuu (りゅう).
Then imagine after his transformation he attacks you using his Street Fighter moves. "Hadouken!"
